content:
I'm happy to help you discover new podcasts! With a 45-minute to 1-hour commute, you've got plenty of time to dive into some engaging episodes. Here are some recommendations across various categories:

**Storytelling & Narrative**

1. **S-Town**: A fascinating true story that unfolds like a mystery novel. (~45-minute episodes)
2. **The Moth**: True stories told live, covering a wide range of topics and emotions. (~30-45 minutes)
3. **Lore**: Delve into dark, mysterious, and often eerie stories from history and folklore. (~30-45 minutes)

**Science & Technology**

1. **Radiolab**: Explore big questions, strange phenomena, and fascinating ideas through storytelling. (~45-minute episodes)
2. **Stuff You Should Know**: Engaging and informative discussions on a wide range of scientific topics. (~45-minute episodes)
3. **StarTalk Radio**: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson explores science, pop culture, and everything in between. (~45-minute episodes)

**History & Culture**

1. **Hardcore History**: In-depth, well-researched historical episodes that'll keep you engaged. (~1-2 hour episodes, but worth it!)
2. **The Dollop**: Comedians and history buffs dive into unusual and often hilarious historical stories. (~45-minute episodes)
3. **Stuff You Missed in History Class**: Explore overlooked historical events and figures. (~30-45 minutes)

**Comedy & Entertainment**

1. **My Brother, My Brother and Me**: Three brothers take questions from listeners and provide hilarious, absurd advice. (~45-minute episodes)
2. **How Did This Get Made?**: Comedians and guests dissect and mock some of the worst movies ever made. (~45-minute episodes)
3. **The Bugle**: John Oliver (formerly of The Daily Show) and Andy Zaltzman discuss news, politics, and more. (~45-minute episodes)

**True Crime & Mystery**

1. **Last Podcast on the Left**: A comedic take on true crime stories, with a focus on lesser-known cases. (~45-minute episodes)
2. **Crime Junkie**: Two friends dive into famous and infamous crimes, with a focus on the facts. (~45-minute episodes)
3. **Casefile True Crime Podcast**: In-depth, well-researched episodes on famous and lesser-known cases. (~45-minute episodes)

**Business & Self-Improvement**

1. **How I Built This**: Guy Raz interviews entrepreneurs and innovators about their journeys. (~30-45 minutes)
2. **The Tim Ferriss Show**: Tim Ferriss digs deep into the habits, routines, and strategies of successful people. (~1-2 hour episodes)
3. **Happier with Gretchen Rubin**: Practical tips and insights on happiness, habits, and human nature. (~30-45 minutes)

I hope you find some new podcasts that resonate with you!
